topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Reconfiguring Ceph Services

body.p:
Perform the following steps to reconfigure the Ceph services.
Login to the Deployer/lifecycle-manager node
Configure the following parameters in the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file.
fsid
ceph clusters
osd_settle_time
OSD_journal_size
Any additional configuration parameters for Ceph (beyond those listed in the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file) can be specified in the same file under the extra: category:extra: osd: journal max write entries: 200
As shown above, configures the OSDs to write a maximum of 200 entries (journal max write entries: 200) to the journal at any one time.The Ceph log parameter debug auth configures the verbosity of the authentication related logs, which is default configured to level of '1/5'. It is a security risk and therefore highly recommended not to have the 'debug auth' logging verbosely, as, the module will start logging the Ceph user secret's, which will be available to users via the centralized logs. Making Ceph cluster vulnerable.
Commit your configuration:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<your commit message>"
Run the playbook to reconfigure the Ceph services:$cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible $ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-reconfigure.yml
